content.description:
Climb obvious vertical crack on front of boulder. Starts as a fist crack and gets wider. Top out on mossy ledge and step up to top. 

 Face holds will make the climbing easier, but can be a great place to run laps on some OW moves.

 Descent: downclimb
content.location: Front of rich lake boulder facing towards the path and the lake. There is a little informational sign on the geology immediatly in front of it.

content.description:
Offwith, left-facing crack that widens into a very thin chimney. Fun OW moves with small holds on inside of the crack right where you need them.

 Have a good spotter, there is a Hemlock and large rock at the base of the climb.

 Top out is not too bad but please respect the vegetation on top.

 Descent: downclimb the crack on the other side of the boulder (Static erratic).
content.location: Obvious left-facing crack facing away from the lake, opposite side of "Extatic erratic".

content.description:
Tall, lonely, boulder along the Rich Lake. The granite erratic splits in two at an odd angle, giving way to two obvious cracks. Tape up!

 Beautiful views of rich lake via the short trail and informational plaques on the local plant life.
